title: Don't prefix full path specification when suggesting changing & to &mut.

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

body:
(moved from https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/issues/6626)

With the following code:
```rust
fn f(vec: &Vec<usize>) {
    vec.push(5);
}
```
I get a suggestion to "change this to a mutable reference", but if I do, I get:
```rust
fn f(vec: &mut std::vec::Vec<usize>) {
    vec.push(5);
}
```

That's a bit overkill, right? I would rather expect
```rust
fn f(vec: &mut Vec<usize>) {
    vec.push(5);
}
```

It actually becomes worse. I've decided to file this bug report after my argument:
```rust
shells: &LocatedShells,
```
was changed to
```rust
shells: &mut topology::located_slice::LocatedBoxedSlice<std::collections::HashMap<usize, shell::Shell, std::hash::BuildHasherDefault<fnv::FnvHasher>>>,
```
instead of just
```rust
shells: &mut LocatedShells,
```

That's definitely overkill, so I end up changing the `&` to `&mut` by hand.
Is this something expected? Or something I can configure not to happen?
